definition: Di Renjie (607-700), Tang dynasty politician, prime minister under Wu Zetian, subsequently hero of legends/master sleuth Judge Dee, aka Chinese Sherlock Holmes, in novel Three murder cases solved by Judge Dee 狄公案[Di2 gong1 an4] translated by Dutch sinologist R.H. van Gulik 高羅珮|高罗佩[Gao1 Luo2 pei4]
low ranking public official (old)
surname Di/generic name for northern ethnic minorities during the Qin and Han Dynasties (221 BC-220 AD)
humane/kernel
hero/heroic/outstanding person/prominent/distinguished

sentences.english: Detective Dee won a nomination for Best Film.
sentences.chinese: 《狄仁傑》獲得最佳電影獎提名。

sentences.english: When Dee Renjie became a minister, she gradually changed from this radical extreme.
sentences.chinese: 而當狄仁傑擔任大臣後，她的激進和極端才逐漸改變。

sentences.english: Detective Dee sweeps HK Film Awards.
sentences.chinese: 《狄仁傑》統領香港電影金像獎。

sentences.english: What attracted you to the character of Dee Renjie?
sentences.chinese: 狄仁傑這一角色爲何會吸引你呢？

definition: Wu Zetian (624-705), Tang empress, reigned 690-705
Liu Chan 劉禪|刘禅 (207-271), son of Liu Bei, reigned as Shu Han emperor 233-263
Sun Bin (-316 BC), political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
Han Xin (-196 BC), famous general of first Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1]
stratagem
Liu Bei (161-223), warlord at the end of the Han dynasty and founder of the Han kingdom of Shu 蜀漢|蜀汉 (c. 200-263), later the Shu Han dynasty
to uphold virtue and condemn evil (idiom)
Liu Bang (256 or 247-195 BC), bandit leader who became first Han emperor Han Gaozu 漢高祖|汉高祖 (reigned 202-195 BC)
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
advice/to advise
Qin Hui (1090-1155 AD), Song Dynasty official said to have betrayed General Yue Fei 岳飛|岳飞[Yue4 Fei1]
to praise
surpassing/excelling/preeminent/unique
capable person
to raise one and infer three/to deduce many things from one case (idiom)
arsenal/store of arms
